name: New Zealand For Kids Quiz / Test | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: New Zealand is a large country located in which ocean?
questions.explanation:
Pacific.

	New Zealand is located in the southwestern Pacific Ocean, approximately 900 miles to the east of Australia. The continent of which New Zealand is a part has been variously referred to as Australia, Australasia and Oceania.

questions.text: Which city is the capital of New Zealand?
questions.explanation:
Wellington.

	Auckland is the biggest city in New Zealand, but Wellington is the capital. It took its name from the famous British soldier and Prime Minister, the Duke of Wellington.

questions.text: New Zealand is made up of a number of islands, but two of these are much bigger than the others and contain most of the population. What are the names of these islands?
options: Greater New Zealand & Lesser New Zealand
questions.explanation:
North Island & South Island.

	North Island is the more heavily populated of the two, containing the cities of Auckland and Wellington. South Island is bigger than its northern neighbour, but with a lot less people living there. The biggest cities on South Island are Christchurch and Dunedin.

questions.text: What name is given to the original inhabitants of New Zealand?
questions.explanation:
Maoris.

	The Maori people originally came from other Pacific islands in the 13th century. In the early 21st century they made up around 15% of the population of New Zealand. They still have their own language, although English is by far the most commonly spoken language in the country.

questions.text: If you visit New Zealand and are into sports, then you will soon become aware that rugby union is the national sport. What is the nickname of the New Zealand national team, who won their second World Cup in 2011?
questions.explanation:
All Blacks.

	The nickname reflects their all black strip. New Zealand won the very first World Cup in 1987, and triumphed again in 2011. On both occasions, they defeated France in the final.

questions.text: New Zealanders are often referred to by which nickname which shares its name with a bird found only in that country?
questions.explanation:
Kiwis.

	The kiwi is a flightless bird found only in New Zealand. The nickname was first used to refer to the country's soldiers, but soon spread to refer to anyone from New Zealand.

questions.text: The highest mountain in New Zealand is named after which famous explorer who visited the islands in the 18th century?
questions.explanation:
James Cook.

	Mount Cook, also known as Aoraki, is located in a mountain range called the Southern Alps, and is over 12,000 feet tall. It is named after the British explorer James Cook who circumnavigated and mapped the country.

questions.text: New Zealand has a great variety of scenery which has led to it being the location for many movies. Which one of these series of films was made in New Zealand?
questions.explanation:
Lord of the Rings.

	The director of the "Lord of the Rings" movies, Peter Jackson, is a New Zealander. All three "LOTR" films were made entirely in his home country.

questions.text: New Zealand was the first modern country in the world to allow women to vote in elections.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In November 1893, women in New Zealand voted in a general election. In comparison, women didn't get to vote in the UK until 1918, whilst American women had to wait unitl 1920 before they were allowed to cast their votes.

questions.text: If you happen to visit New Zealand on February 6th, you will be able to help them celebrate which annual holiday?
questions.explanation:
Waitangi Day.

	Waitangi Day celebrates the signing of the Treaty of Waitangi in 1840, the document which formally created New Zealand as a nation. Independence Day and Memorial Day are American holidays which are not recognised in New Zealand.
